project.teaser: The MED region includes more than 25 million hectares of forests and about 50 million hectares of other wooded lands. Climatic and socio-economic changes in this region could have serious consequences for forests, potentially resulting in the loss of ecosystem services and...
project.objective:
The MED region includes more than 25 million hectares of forests and about 50 million hectares of other wooded lands. Climatic and socio-economic changes in this region could have serious consequences for forests, potentially resulting in the loss of ecosystem services and causing a wide range of economic, social, and environmental issues. The low competitiveness of the forest-wood supply chain in European Mediterranean (EUMED) countries is currently amplified by the missing or limited access of forest managers and companies to current and new digital technologies which appear to be out of date in certain key areas or fail to address some of the most pressing difficulties that the industry is expected to be confronting in the next decades. This rationale calls for the urgent implementation of a multi-actor approach to digitalization, starting from recognizing stakeholders’ needs and subsequently defining joint actions. To this end DigiMedFor's overall goal is to transform the technological landscape of the Mediterranean forest-wood supply chain by increasing its competitiveness, thus allowing the different stakeholders to better manage and supply multiple forest ecosystem services, including the traceability of wood origin from forests to end-users.
In line with the EU forest strategy and the EU digital strategy, DigiMedFor will employ advanced and innovative digital solutions to improve the monitoring and management of forest resources along the supply chain from their origin up to the wood industry, optimising both the sustainability of wood production and traceability and delivery of ecosystem services. DigiMedFor will address the synergetic use of geo-spatial, AI, and modelling technologies, combining them with ICT.
project.title: Digital tools and technology systems for the sustainable management of Mediterranean forest resources
project.keywords: Spatial DSS, Web-GIS, European Mediterranean forests, forest modelling, wood traceability, wood quality

result.title: Stakeholders’ engagement and consultation Plan
result.description: Stakeholders’ engagement and consultation Plan (T7.3), a detailed plan on DIGIMEDFOR stakeholders and how to involve them in the project effectively

result.title: Dissemination and communication strategy and plan
result.description: Dissemination and communication strategy and plan (T7.1), a detailed plan including the dissemination and communication activities, the timeplan for these activities, the targets, the channels, etc..

result.title: AI-based predictive models
result.description: Document including the parameters and the inputs of AI based predictive models (T4.2) along with the required output of the VFDSS that will be developed in Task 4.4

result.title: Updated dissemination and communication strategy and plan
result.description: Updated dissemination and communication strategy and plan (7.1), an update of the plan at M18

result.title: DigiMedFor toolkit for forest managers to measure forest variables and attributes
result.description: DigiMedFor toolkit for forest managers to measure forest variables and attributes (T2.2), technical and video material to help users to have a wide-angle discussion with stakeholders in achieving the best possible plan in measuring forest variables and attributes using both aerial and ground sensor digital systems

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DIGIMEDFOR (Digital tools and technology systems for the sustainable management of Mediterranean forest resources)
result.teaser: The forest economy is becoming more complex and connected worldwide. Factors like climate change, energy policies, new technologies, and the growing importance of ecosystem services are all having an impact. The ability of forests, woodlands, and trees to fulfil the increasing...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: DigiMedFor Knowledge Platform
result.description: DigiMedFor Knowledge Platform (T4.1), an open-source web application for decision-makers in MED forestry private and public bodies.This deliverable integrates also results coming from T2.3 and 2.4.

result.title: Project Management & Quality Plan
result.description: The Project Management & Quality Plan (T1.1), a detailed plan for the implementation of the project (list of activities, monitoring program, quality assurance processes, critical risks for implementation and contingency plans, etc..)

result.title: Regulatory framework
result.description: Regulatory framework (T6.6), regulatory framework in which DigiMedFor solutions are introduced

result.title: Pilot evaluation handbook
result.description: Pilot evaluation handbook (T5.1), evaluation plan and templates will be developed to guide the evaluation of the project pilots. A specific evaluation plan for each pilot will be created. The evaluation plans will provide answers to the following questions, among others: what are the methods to be used in performing the evaluation? what are the KPIs to be used? what data will need to be collected from the pilots? how will this information be collected and who will provide it? what are the limitations that may be faced regarding the data to be collected and the results of the evaluation?

result.title: Prospective customers and value propositions
result.description: Prospective customers and value propositions (T6.1), report identifying suitable customers for the major project results along with fitting value propositions that can guide their further development and commercialisation beyond the grant

result.title: Process-based mathematical model
result.description: Process-based mathematical model (T4.3), a mathematical model by system dynamic and Individual-based model approach to simulate and predict the dynamic behaviour of a forest system

result.title: Practice abstracts – batch 1
result.description: Practice abstracts – batch 1 (T7.3), a first batch of practice abstracts on digitalisation in the forestry sector

result.title: Data Management Plan intermediate plan
result.description: Data Management Plan intermediate plan including an update of the initial DMP (T1.2)

result.title: Initial Exploitation Plan
result.description: Initial Exploitation Plan (T6.3), Initial exploitation plan including the description of Key Exploitable Results (KERs) and initial thoughts on the potential market and on how to protect the KERs.

result.title: Report on DigiMedFor forest data
result.description: Report on the forest inventories including some quantified data (T2.1), based on available sources metadata

result.title: Data Management Plan initial plan
result.description: Initial draft of the Data Management Plan Data describing the detailed processes to manage data within the project (T1.2)

category.title: geographic information systems
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/physical geography/cartography/geographic information systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
